trans-unit.source: Contains values used as identifiers for <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Provider.ITextProvider"></xref>.
<xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern> exposes detailed information of the textual contents of objects such as edit controls and documents.
UI Automation providers should be written so that they can work in a partial-trust environment.
Because UIAutomationClient.dll is not configured for full trust, your provider code should not reference that assembly.
If it does so, the code may run in a full-trust environment but then fail in a partial-trust environment.
In particular, do not use fields from classes in UIAutomationClient.dll such as those in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationElement>.
Instead, use the equivalent fields from classes in UIAutomationTypes.dll, such as <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationElementIdentifiers>.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Text.AnimationStyle"></xref> attribute of a text range.
Animations appear on the screen only; the animated text prints, but the animation effect does not.
This identifier is used by UI Automation providers.
UI Automation client applications should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern>.
Values for this attribute are of type <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.AnimationStyle>.
The default value is <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.AnimationStyle.None>.
Identifies the [BackgroundColor](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/default.asp?url=/library/gdi/colors_9xiq.asp) attribute of a text range.
This identifier is used by UI Automation providers.
UI Automation client applications should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern>.
Values for this attribute are of type <xref:System.Int32>.
The default value is a `null` reference (`Nothing` in [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_visualbnet](~/includes/tlasharptla-visualbnet-md.md)]).
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Text.BulletStyle"></xref> attribute of a text range.
This identifier is used by UI Automation providers.
UI Automation client applications should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern>.
Values for this attribute are of type <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.BulletStyle>.
The default value is <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.BulletStyle.None>.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Text.CapStyle"></xref> attribute of a text range.
This identifier is used by UI Automation providers.
UI Automation client applications should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern>.
Values for this attribute are of type <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.CapStyle>.
The default value is <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.CapStyle.None>.

Identifies the Culture (<xref href="System.Globalization.CultureInfo"></xref>) attribute of a text range down to the sub-language level; for example, Frenchâ€“Switzerland (fr-CH) instead of French (fr).
This identifier is used by UI Automation providers.
UI Automation client applications should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern>.
Values for this attribute are of type <xref:System.Globalization.CultureInfo>.
See <xref:System.Globalization.CultureInfo> in the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_netframewk](~/includes/tlasharptla-netframewk-md.md)] for more detail on the language code format.
The default value is the language of the application [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_ui](~/includes/tlasharptla-ui-md.md)].
There might be cases where the server does not support the language tag or authors cannot use it.
In those cases the default applies.
Identifies the FontName attribute of a text range.
Examples include "Arial Black" and "Arial Narrow".
Values are non-localized.
This identifier is used by UI Automation providers.
UI Automation client applications should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern>.
Values for this attribute are of type <xref:System.String>.
The default value is an `empty string`.
Identifies the FontSize attribute of a text range.
This identifier is used by UI Automation providers.
UI Automation client applications should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern>.
Values for this attribute are of type <xref:System.Double>.
The default value is `zero`.
Identifies the FontWeight attribute of a text range.
Refers to the relative stroke, thickness or boldness of a font.
This is modeled after the `lfWeight` field in [GDI LOGFONT](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/default.asp?url=/library/gdi/fontext_1wmq.asp).

For consistency, the following values have been adopted from LOGFONT: 0=DontCare, 100=Thin, 200=ExtraLight or UltraLight, 300=Light, 400=Normal or Regular, 500=Medium, 600=SemiBold or DemiBold, 700=Bold, 800=ExtraBold or UltraBold, and 900=Heavy or Black.
This identifier is used by UI Automation providers.
UI Automation client applications should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern>.
Values for this attribute are of type <xref:System.Int32>.
The default value is `zero`.

Identifies the [ForegroundColor](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/default.asp?url=/library/gdi/colors_9xiq.asp) ([COLORREF](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/default.asp?url=/library/gdi/colors_9xiq.asp)) attribute of a text range.
Foreground color is equivalent to the text or font color.
This identifier is used by UI Automation providers.
UI Automation client applications should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern>.
Values for this attribute are of type <xref:System.Int32>.
The default value is a `null` reference (`Nothing` in [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_visualbnet](~/includes/tlasharptla-visualbnet-md.md)]).
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Text.HorizontalTextAlignment"></xref> attribute of a text range.
The horizontal text alignment applied to the paragraph(s) associated with the calling text range.
This identifier is used by UI Automation providers.
UI Automation client applications should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern>.
Values for this attribute are of type
The default value is <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.HorizontalTextAlignment.Left>
Identifies the IndentationFirstLine () attribute of a text range.
The first-line indentation (specified as a <xref:System.Drawing.GraphicsUnit.Point> unit type value) applied to the paragraph(s) associated with the calling text range.
This identifier is used by UI Automation providers.
UI Automation client applications should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern>.
Values for this attribute are of type <xref:System.Double>.
The default value is `zero`.
Identifies the IndentationLeading () attribute of a text range.
The leading indentation (specified as a <xref:System.Drawing.GraphicsUnit.Point> unit type value) applied to the paragraph(s) associated with the calling text range.
This identifier is used by UI Automation providers.
UI Automation client applications should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern>.
Values for this attribute are of type <xref:System.Double>.
The default value is `zero`.
Identifies the IndentationTrailing () attribute of a text range.
The trailing indentation (specified as a <xref:System.Drawing.GraphicsUnit.Point> unit type value) applied to the paragraph(s) associated with the calling text range.
This identifier is used by UI Automation providers.
UI Automation client applications should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern>.
Values for this attribute are of type <xref:System.Double>.
The default value is `zero`.
Identifies the IsHidden attribute of a text range.
This identifier is used by UI Automation providers.
UI Automation client applications should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern>.
Values for this attribute are of type <xref:System.Boolean>.
The default value is `false`.
Identifies the IsItalic () attribute of a text range.
This identifier is used by UI Automation providers.
UI Automation client applications should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern>.
Values for this attribute are of type <xref:System.Boolean>.
The default value is `false`.
Identifies the IsReadOnly attribute of a text range.
The read-only state of the document associated with the calling text range.
If a document or file is read-only, but you can still edit it and save it as another file, the text is not considered read-only.
This identifier is used by UI Automation providers.
UI Automation client applications should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern>.
Values for this attribute are of type <xref:System.Boolean>.
The default value is `false`.
Identifies the IsSubscript () attribute of a text range.
This identifier is used by UI Automation providers.
UI Automation client applications should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern>.
Values for this attribute are of type <xref:System.Boolean>.
The default value is `false`.
Identifies the IsSuperscript () attribute of a text range.
This identifier is used by UI Automation providers.
UI Automation client applications should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern>.
Values for this attribute are of type <xref:System.Boolean>.
The default value is `false`.
Identifies the MarginBottom () attribute of a text range.
The bottom margin applied to the page(s) associated with the calling text range.
This identifier is used by UI Automation providers.
UI Automation client applications should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern>.
Values for this attribute are of type <xref:System.Double>.
The default value is `zero`.
Identifies the MarginLeading () attribute of a text range.
The leading margin applied to the page(s) associated with the calling text range.
This identifier is used by UI Automation providers.
UI Automation client applications should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern>.
Values for this attribute are of type <xref:System.Double>.
The default value is `zero`.
Identifies the MarginTop () attribute of a text range.
The top margin applied to the page(s) associated with the calling text range.
This identifier is used by UI Automation providers.
UI Automation client applications should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern>.
Values for this attribute are of type <xref:System.Double>.
The default value is `zero`.
Identifies the MarginTrailing () attribute of a text range.
The trailing margin applied to the page(s) associated with the calling text range.
This identifier is used by UI Automation providers.
UI Automation client applications should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern>.
Values for this attribute are of type <xref:System.Double>.
The default value is `zero`.
Identifies whether the value of a given attribute varies over a text range in a rich edit control.
<xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.TextPatternRange.GetAttributeValue%2A> returns `TextPattern.MixedAttributeValue` to indicate this variation instead of a collection of attribute values.
This identifier is used by UI Automation providers.
UI Automation client applications should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern>.
Values for this attribute are of type <xref:System.Object>.
Identifies the OutlineStyles () attribute of a text range.
This identifier is used by UI Automation providers.
UI Automation client applications should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern>.
Values for this attribute are of type <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.OutlineStyles>.
The default value is <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.OutlineStyles.None>.
Identifies the OverlineColor attribute of a text range.
This identifier is used by UI Automation providers.
UI Automation client applications should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern>.
Values for this attribute are of type <xref:System.Int32>.
The default value is `null` reference (`Nothing` in [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_visualbnet](~/includes/tlasharptla-visualbnet-md.md)]).
Identifies the OverlineStyle () attribute of a text range.
This identifier is used by UI Automation providers.
UI Automation client applications should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern>.
Values for this attribute are of type <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.TextDecorationLineStyle>.
The default value is <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.TextDecorationLineStyle.None>.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern"></xref> pattern.
This identifier is used by UI Automation providers.
UI Automation client applications should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern>.
Identifies the StrikethroughColor attribute of a text range.
This identifier is used by UI Automation providers.
UI Automation client applications should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern>.
Values for this attribute are of type <xref:System.Int32>.
The default value is a `null` reference (`Nothing` in [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_visualbnet](~/includes/tlasharptla-visualbnet-md.md)]).
Identifies the StrikethroughStyle () attribute of a text range.
This identifier is used by UI Automation providers.
UI Automation client applications should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern>.
Values for this attribute are of type <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.TextDecorationLineStyle>.
The default value is <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.TextDecorationLineStyle.None>.
Identifies the Tabs attribute of a text range.
The collection of tab stops has each tab stop specified as a <xref:System.Drawing.GraphicsUnit.Point> unit type value.
This identifier is used by UI Automation providers.
UI Automation client applications should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern>.
Values for this attribute are an array of type <xref:System.Double>.
The default value is an `empty` array.
Identifies the event raised whenever textual content is modified.
This identifier is used by UI Automation providers.
UI Automation client applications should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern>.
Identifies the TextFlowDirections () attribute of a text range.
This identifier is used by UI Automation providers.
UI Automation client applications should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern>.
Values for this attribute are of type <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.FlowDirections>.

The default value is the bitwise combination of the following values: <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.FlowDirections.Vertical> `|` <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.FlowDirections.RightToLeft> `|` <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.FlowDirections.BottomToTop>.
Identifies the event raised whenever the text selection is modified.
Some text controls handle the text insertion point (cursor) as a zero-width text selection and might raise `TextSelectionChangedEvent` when the cursor is moved.

To follow cursor movements, UI Automation clients are advised to keep track of insertion point changes by listening for corresponding [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uiautomation](~/includes/tla2sharptla-uiautomation-md.md)] element events rather than depending on <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern.TextSelectionChangedEvent>.
This identifier is used by [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uiautomation](~/includes/tla2sharptla-uiautomation-md.md)] providers.
Client applications should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern>.
Identifies the UnderlineColor attribute of a text range.
This identifier is used by UI Automation providers.
UI Automation client applications should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern>.
Values for this attribute are of type <xref:System.Int32>.
The default value is a `null` reference (`Nothing` in [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_visualbnet](~/includes/tlasharptla-visualbnet-md.md)]).
Identifies the UnderlineStyle () attribute of a text range.
This identifier is used by UI Automation providers.
UI Automation client applications should use the equivalent field in <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern>.
Values for this attribute are of type <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.TextDecorationLineStyle>.
The default value is <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Text.TextDecorationLineStyle.None>.
